trans-unit.source: The process dialogues of cc|mobile solution offer multiple settings that can be partially applied in the Microsoft Dynamics NAV RoleTailored Client and also in the underlying Codeunit. The different settings are explained in the following sections.

seg-source.mrk: The process dialogues of cc|mobile solution offer multiple settings that can be partially applied in the Microsoft Dynamics NAV RoleTailored Client and also in the underlying Codeunit.
The different settings are explained in the following sections.

trans-unit.source: Mobile Setup, Universal Dlg. Settings FastTab

The settings in this FastTab apply to all process dialogues that use the Universal Dialogue. The fields on this FastTab are described in section <MadCap:xref href="Mobile Application Setup.htm#Universa" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Universal Dlg. Settings FastTab” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

seg-source.mrk: The settings in this FastTab apply to all process dialogues that use the Universal Dialogue.

The fields on this FastTab are described in section <MadCap:xref href="Mobile Application Setup.htm#Universa" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Universal Dlg. Settings FastTab” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

trans-unit.source: The settings in this FastTab apply to a specific process dialogue. The fields on this FastTab are described in topic <MadCap:xref href="Document Editor.htm#Universa" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Universal Dlg. Settings FastTab” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

seg-source.mrk: The settings in this FastTab apply to a specific process dialogue.

The fields on this FastTab are described in topic <MadCap:xref href="Document Editor.htm#Universa" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Universal Dlg. Settings FastTab” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the current process dialogues that use the universal dialogue and their supported settings ("-" not supported) with the corresponding default values (ON / OFF).

seg-source.mrk: The following table shows the current process dialogues that use the universal dialogue and their supported settings ("-" not supported) with the corresponding default values (ON / OFF).

trans-unit.source: The “Print” setting must be configured in a commented area in the underlying Codeunit.

seg-source.mrk: The “Print” setting must be configured in a commented area in the underlying Codeunit.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the settings in the Microsoft Dynamics NAV RoleTailored Client, there are several other settings in the codeunits according to the documents.

seg-source.mrk: In addition to the settings in the Microsoft Dynamics NAV RoleTailored Client, there are several other settings in the codeunits according to the documents.

trans-unit.source: By using the Universal Dialogue, the user can be asked for additional fields that are not implemented in the default process dialogues.

seg-source.mrk: By using the Universal Dialogue, the user can be asked for additional fields that are not implemented in the default process dialogues.

trans-unit.source: Process dialogues have two parameters that can be used for getting two additional values. The following global variables can be used for collecting additional values:

seg-source.mrk: Process dialogues have two parameters that can be used for getting two additional values.
The following global variables can be used for collecting additional values:

trans-unit.source: SpecialFields represent a Field No. of the Table 83 “Item Journal Line”. To buffer those values, the table was extended by fields of different data types.

seg-source.mrk: To buffer those values, the table was extended by fields of different data types.

trans-unit.source: It is possible that some of the fields are already used by the Codeunits. Therefore it is important to check that the desired field is “available” for SpecialFields usage. It is also possible to use default fields of the table, but in this case a check of “already-in-use” should be done.

seg-source.mrk: It is possible that some of the fields are already used by the Codeunits.
Therefore it is important to check that the desired field is “available” for SpecialFields usage.
It is also possible to use default fields of the table, but in this case a check of “already-in-use” should be done.

trans-unit.source: In the process dialogues, an initial implementation for SpecialFields has to be adjusted.

seg-source.mrk: In the process dialogues, an initial implementation for SpecialFields has to be adjusted.

trans-unit.source: The InitMD function contains the following lines:

seg-source.mrk: The InitMD function contains the following lines:

trans-unit.source: The Field No. of the value to be asked for must be assigned to the variable “SpecialFields”. The variable “SpecialFieldsCaptions” specifies the desired caption to be displayed.

seg-source.mrk: of the value to be asked for must be assigned to the variable “SpecialFields”.
The variable “SpecialFieldsCaptions” specifies the desired caption to be displayed.

trans-unit.source: Since Data Type = Text, the GEN.TransDef() function can be used for Labeltexts to ensure Multilingual Support.

seg-source.mrk: Since Data Type = Text, the GEN.TransDef() function can be used for Labeltexts to ensure Multilingual Support.

trans-unit.source: After running the Universal Dialogue, the values can be processed in the FinishMD(); function.

seg-source.mrk: After running the Universal Dialogue, the values can be processed in the FinishMD(); function.
